intro: Astragalus lamprocarpus, commonly known as the silverleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers clustered in spherical heads, which are characteristic of the Fabaceae family. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus lamprocarpus is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
